verbose_text: IL-6 acts through several classic protein kinase cascades such as MAPK and phosphatidylinositoltriphosphate kinase (PI-3 kinase), but can also directly activate the signal transducers and activators of transcription (STAT) factors STAT1 and STAT3, due to the capability of acting by Janus kinases (JAK).
evidence: IL-6 acts through several classic protein kinase cascades such as MAPK and phosphatidylinositoltriphosphate kinase (PI-3 kinase), but can also directly activate the signal transducers and activators of transcription (STAT) factors STAT1
